summary: The U.S. dollar is the money used in the United States and some other countries. It was first used in 1792 and is made up of 100 cents. The dollar is represented by the symbol "$" and is often called "buck" in everyday speech. U.S. money includes coins and paper money, known as Federal Reserve Notes, which are mostly green. The Federal Reserve controls the country's money system. Over time, the dollar's value has changed, and it is now used worldwide for buying and selling things.
title: United States dollar
